definition[0]: a substance that is not a solid or a gas, for example water or milk
example[0]: Add a little more liquid to the sauce.
definition[1]: in the form of a liquid instead of a gas or solid
example[1]: Children take antibiotics in liquid form.
definition[2]: easily changed into money by being sold or exchanged
example[3]: Their shares are more liquid than those of many smaller companies.
definition[4]: liquid sounds are clear and pure
definition[5]: involving cash, or things that can easily be changed into cash
example[5]: In a modern economy, liquid wealth is held in the form of money.
definition[6]: involving things that can easily be bought and sold
example[6]: the well-developed, highly liquid and sophisticated money market in London
